home.meta_description: Hello, it’s me, Alfonso. On this website you can find a little bit about my work and my interests, it is also a good place to connect. Please come in

posts.title: Posts
posts.meta_description: Posts related to frontend and backend development, design, technology, and maybe other subjects that I may find interesting.

labs.title: Labs
labs.description: In this section you can find some personal side-projects and experiments that I am doing during my spare time.
labs.meta_description: In this section, I want to share some of the personal projects and experiments that I am doing in addition to my daily job

about.meta_description: Created this site to discuss the topics that interest me, share some of the projects I am working and to hopefully teach and learn something along the way.

contact.title: Contact Me
contact.intro: Comments, inquiries, suggestions, or want to say hi? I’d love to hear! Fill this form out and hit send.
contact.meta_description: If you have any questions or comments or would like to make a proposal, feel free to use the contact form on this page.
contact.success_message: Your message was successfully sent. If you are not a spam bot, or you are a very good spam bot, you should receive a response from me within a few hours.

form.what_can_i_do: What can I do for you?

resume.meta_description: Alfonso Bribiesca is a full-stack developer with more than {{yearsOfExperience}} years of experience building software for a wide variety of businesses around the world.
resume.im_an_expert_intro: The following is a list of the different technologies where I have a deep understanding of their inner workings, have used them to solve real-world problems, and feel confident in my ability to use them in a professional setting, either leading a team or as an individual.
resume.strong_knowledge_intro: I have worked with the following technologies over the last several years. However, I have only had a few opportunities to use them to their full potential. Still, I have a solid and extensive knowledge of them, and I am ready to use them on any production project that comes on my way.
